13月

This character is actually a picture of the moon、 with the two horizontal lines representing the left eye and mouth of the mythical “man in the moon。” （Actually、 the Japanese see a hare in the moon、 but it is a little farfetched to find one in the kanji。） And one month、 of course、 is one cycle of the moon。 As a primitive element、 this character can take on the sense of moon、 flesh、 or part of the body。 The reasons for the latter two meanings will be explained in a later chapter。



Onyomi

ゲツガツ

Kunyomi

つき
